alert.note: Alert for Christian; Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 23 at 11:43PM CDT until March 24 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Christian County in southwestern Missouri... Northern Stone County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 500 AM CDT. * At 1143 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding was occuring from heavy rainfall from thunderstorms across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Department of Transportation. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ozark, Highlandville, Sparta, Crane, Galena, Mccord Bend, Spokane, Chestnutridge, Selmore, Christian Center, Ponce de Leon, Chadwick, Oldfield, Garrison, Bruner, Elsey, Keltner, Cape Fair, Elkhead and Table Rock Lake. This includes the following low water crossings... Swan Creek at Swan Cave Road, Finley River at Johns Ford Road, Tory Creek at Highway O, Woods Fork at Woods Fork Road, Bull Creek at Center Road, Silver Lake Branch at Highway U and Tin Can Hollow at Highway CC. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
